title: XSS on OAuth authorize/authenticate endpoint

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,
I would like to report an issue where certain endpoints on twitter.com and api.twitter.com is vulnerable to XSS.

##Detail
The redirection page after authorization/authentication does not sanitize the *oauth_callback* parameter.

##PoC
1. Go to http://innerht.ml/pocs/twitter-oauth-xss (Please use IE or something that hasn't implemented CSP)
2. Click on Authorize app
3. Alert pops up

Note: it also affects api.twitter.com as they both have the same endpoints

##Repo step
1. Obtain the request token (https://api.twitter.com/oauth/request_token) where parameter *oauth_callback* contains HTML like ```javascript%3A%2F%2F"><script>alert(document.domain)</script>```
2. Redirect the victim to the authorize/authenticate page with the token
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,
I would like to report an issue where certain endpoints on twitter.com and api.twitter.com is vulnerable to XSS.

Detail

The redirection page after authorization/authentication does not sanitize the oauth_callback parameter.

PoC

  1. Go to http://innerht.ml/pocs/twitter-oauth-xss (Please use IE or something that hasn't implemented CSP)
  2. Click on Authorize app
  3. Alert pops up

Note: it also affects api.twitter.com as they both have the same endpoints

Repo step

  1. Obtain the request token (https://api.twitter.com/oauth/request_token) where parameter oauth_callback contains HTML like javascript%3A%2F%2F"><script>alert(document.domain)</script>
  2. Redirect the victim to the authorize/authenticate page with the token

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

We're having difficulty reproducing the issue you are reporting.  You mentioned that it only works on certain browsers?  Please keep in mind that per our [program rules](https://hackerone.com/twitter) "Vulnerabilities affecting users of outdated or unpatched browsers and platforms" are not in scope.  Can you clarify exactly what browsers/versions this is working on so that we can more easily evaluate this issue?

Thanks for thinking of Twitter security!

activities.message:
Hi @bugtriage,
It works on latest IE.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @bugtriage,
It works on latest IE.

activities.message:
Hi,
I have made another PoC that works in all browsers with dangling markup to bypass CSP to steal the *authenticity_token*.
https://innerht.ml/pocs/twitter-oauth-xss/csrf.php
After authorizing the app [this tweet](https://twitter.com/mashable/status/606690071266357248) should be automatically favorited.
Notice the app only has read permission (I made this to avoid confusion to show it is not the app that favorites the tweet but the victim's browser).
activities.markdown_message:
Hi,
I have made another PoC that works in all browsers with dangling markup to bypass CSP to steal the authenticity_token.
https://innerht.ml/pocs/twitter-oauth-xss/csrf.php
After authorizing the app this tweet should be automatically favorited.
Notice the app only has read permission (I made this to avoid confusion to show it is not the app that favorites the tweet but the victim's browser).

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message: Thanks again. As mentioned we’ll keep you updated as we investigate further. As a reminder, please remember to keep the details of this report private until we have fully investigated and addressed the issue.

activities.message:
Hi @mfinifter, Now the critical characters are converted to HTML entities, but it should also check if the URL is a valid URL. For example, attacker can still make users to click on the continue link to trigger XSS via ```javascript:``` pseudo protocol. ```html

If your browser doesn't redirect you please click here to continue

```
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @mfinifter,
Now the critical characters are converted to HTML entities, but it should also check if the URL is a valid URL.

For example, attacker can still make users to click on the continue link to trigger XSS via javascript: pseudo protocol.

<p>If your browser doesn't redirect you please 
<a class="maintain-context" href="javascript://%0aalert(1)//?oauth_token=xxx">click here to continue</a></p>

activities.message: Thanks, @filedescriptor .  I've re-engaged the team to implement a more complete fix.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks, @filedescriptor . I've re-engaged the team to implement a more complete fix.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

activities.message:
Hi @mfinifter,
Now ```javascript:``` is forbidden but there are still other pseudo protocols that allow XSS. For example ```vbscript:``` in IE.
I suggest to use white-list approach when it comes to this kind of situation.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @mfinifter,
Now javascript: is forbidden but there are still other pseudo protocols that allow XSS. For example vbscript: in IE.
I suggest to use white-list approach when it comes to this kind of situation.

activities.message:
We consider this issue to be fixed now. Can you please confirm?

Implementing a whitelist approach is, unfortunately, infeasible at this time, though we do plan to pursue this in the future.  We have added vbscript to the blacklist.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!
activities.markdown_message:

Implementing a whitelist approach is, unfortunately, infeasible at this time, though we do plan to pursue this in the future. We have added vbscript to the blacklist.
